SEARCH
Package io.brane.rpc

Class DefaultWalletClient

java.lang.Object
io.brane.rpc.DefaultWalletClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
WalletClient
public final class DefaultWalletClient extends Object implements WalletClient
Default implementation of WalletClient with automatic transaction preparation.

This class implements the complete transaction lifecycle:

  1. Fills missing gas parameters via SmartGasStrategy
  2. Fetches nonce via eth_getTransactionCount if not provided
  3. Signs the transaction using Signer
  4. Broadcasts via eth_sendRawTransaction
  5. Optionally polls for receipt via eth_getTransactionReceipt

Chain ID Enforcement: Validates that the configured chain ID matches the connected node's chain ID on first transaction. Caches the result using AtomicReference for thread-safe lazy initialization.

Thread Safety: This class is thread-safe. Multiple threads can submit transactions concurrently.

Usage: Typically created via a builder pattern, not instantiated directly.

See Also:
  • WalletClient
  • SmartGasStrategy
  • Signer

    • sendTransaction

      public Hash sendTransaction(TransactionRequest request)
      Description copied from interface: WalletClient
      Submits a transaction to the blockchain and returns immediately.

      This method:

      1. Fills in missing gas/nonce fields if null in the request
      2. Signs the transaction using the configured signer
      3. Broadcasts via eth_sendRawTransaction
      4. Returns the transaction hash without waiting for confirmation

      Note: The transaction is submitted but NOT confirmed. Use WalletClient.sendTransactionAndWait(io.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest, long, long) if you need to wait for confirmation.

      Specified by:
      sendTransaction in interface WalletClient
      Parameters:
      request - the transaction request with at minimum a from address; all other fields are optional and will be auto-filled
      Returns:
      the transaction hash of the submitted transaction

    • sendTransactionAndWait

      public TransactionReceipt sendTransactionAndWait(TransactionRequest request, long timeoutMillis, long pollIntervalMillis)
      Description copied from interface: WalletClient
      Submits a transaction and waits for it to be confirmed in a block.

      This method combines WalletClient.sendTransaction(io.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest) with polling for the receipt. It will:

      1. Submit the transaction (same as WalletClient.sendTransaction(io.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest))
      2. Poll eth_getTransactionReceipt at the specified interval
      3. Return the receipt once the transaction is included in a block
      4. Throw an exception if timeout is reached or transaction reverts

      Revert Detection: If the transaction is included but reverts (status = false), this method will decode the revert reason and throw a RevertException with details.

      Specified by:
      sendTransactionAndWait in interface WalletClient
      Parameters:
      request - the transaction request
      timeoutMillis - maximum time to wait for confirmation, in milliseconds
      pollIntervalMillis - how often to poll for the receipt, in milliseconds
      Returns:
      the transaction receipt once confirmed
